samples.situation: I'm about to lose my job because my company is not able to negotiate my existing contract and I'm unable to secure another job. I feel anxiety on what to do and next steps to take.

samples.situation: I am recently divorced. My ex-husband has moved in with his new, much younger girlfriend and they are discussing marriage. Although I am happy the marriage is over, I'm depressed because I have not had any romantic offers while he has moved on with no problem.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm feeling a little bit down today. I've been feeling a little bit down a lot lately.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh no. I'm sorry to hear that. What do you think would be the cause of you feeling down lately?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My ex-husband is moved in with his new girlfriend. They might get married.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh Keri, that must feel awful. Was it a recent separation between you two?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He started dating a few months after we split up. I don't know if this is the only person he's dated but I think so. He really moved on quick.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hi, are you still there?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah I understand what you're going through. I was in a similar position not too long ago. I had a hard time wrapping my head around how fast my ex could move on from what we had. How does it make you feel that he's trying to start a new relationship so soon after yours?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It makes me feel like he didn't learn anything from our relationship or like he thinks he's better than me because he has someone new and I don't. I'm trying to take some time and be alone and be okay with being alone, which is good I think, but sometimes I feel really really lonely too. Like maybe I won't ever find anyone.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That must feel really isolating. But working on yourself and becoming a better you is the only way to move on in a healthy manner. I think you're doing the right thing in waiting and learning to love yourself before you can open up and love another.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you! Exactly. But it is scary. I am guessing from your name that you identify as male (please forgive me if that is incorrect), so you might not understand what it feels like to be an older woman when your ex starts dating someone a lot younger. Men only get better and more desirable with age, not so for women.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I might not understand that particular aspect, but self worth is still self worth no matter the context. I'd say try not to pay any mind to what he's up to. The grass always looks greener on the other side of the fence, but if you just focus on watering your grass (making yourself happy) then you'll have a much more fulfilling life.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Haha, watering my own grass. That is a good way to put it. Thank you for talking to me for a few minutes. It makes me feel a little bit better to have someone agree that it is okay to spend time working on me, instead of thinking that it is sad or pathetic or an excuse. I really appreciate it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh absolutely Keri. Thanks for opening up and sharing your experience and feelings with me for just a few minutes. It was great to talk to you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Have a good night, Jonathan. :-)

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Happy Holidays Keri. Keep your head up!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been trying to focus on some hobbies to keep my mind busy. It's been a little helpful.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's great to hear! Engaging in hobbies can really be a positive distraction. What kinds of things have you been doing?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I've started painting again. It used to be a passion of mine, but I kind of let it go after the divorce.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Painting sounds like a wonderful outlet for your emotions. It's fantastic that you're reconnecting with something that brings you joy. How does it feel to express yourself through art again?

samples.situation: I keep trying to get started, but my kitchen mess seems so overwhelming.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I get it. Sometimes I find dishes so overwhelming that I will let them pile up. Maybe together we can figure out a way to break it into smaller tasks.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ok, I suppose I can try that. But I don't quite know where to start.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It is so hard to figure out where to start sometimes. Ok, I'll help with a plan. Maybe you can glance at the dishes and pull out the largest one that is dirty. Let's start there.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ok. That makes sense. There is a large pot. I think if I was that, maybe it would get me started.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: yes, starting with the large pot would be a great place to start! Good thinking!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ok, but then what?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well, washing the pot will make the overall task look smaller. Then, let's pick a second type of dish to focus on. After you wash the large pot, try to focus on larger bowls, then plates and cups. You could leave the silverware for last.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Oh, thank you so much! It helps my anxiety to talk through a plan. Sometimes I get so anxious, it is hard to figure out how to break a large task down to something manageable on my own.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am always happy to help. I find it difficult sometimes too.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I really think you are figure out how to get through this and help your anxiety.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Wow do you think so?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Have you every had anxiety like this?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I have. I often look at work assignments as larger than they are and can only get started when I break them down.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I really think you have done great job figuring out how to tackle the task that is causing you anxiety.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I feel a bit better after talking about tackling the dishes. It's nice to feel less overwhelmed.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: I'm glad to hear that you're feeling a bit better! It can really help to share your thoughts. What part of the process are you feeling most comfortable with now?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I think just knowing I have a plan helps. I feel more capable of washing that big pot.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds great! Having a plan can make such a big difference. Just remember to take your time with each step, and celebrate each dish you finish!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: I am very scare of this pandemic call COVID-19

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am really afraid here I don't know what to do

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: As for the pandemic, if you know no one who has died, I wouldn't worry about it. The CDC has no reported deaths of anyone healthy. People who are unhealthy die, not the healthy, and people who are sick ALREADY are the ones who die. If you are relatively healthy, then you are good to go. Do things to protect your health. What are you eating? What are you drinking? Are you talking to friends and getting social life? Are you getting fresh air? Thinking good thoughts?  Or are you living in fear when you are not going to a lot of funerals.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It is well documented that our immune system is affected by our mental state, so it is important that you care for your health. Focusing on the negativity of the pandemic will bring you down. Focusing on being healthy and taking care of your mind, soul, spirit and body will help build up your immunity and make you strong.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I don't like the noise of ambulance at all any time I see one I don't feel happy

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can understand an ambulance sound is hard to hear, but even that can be turned around. You can pray for the person, then switch your mind off. If you focus on the negative, you will stay negative. If you do what you can (pray) then there is nothing else to do. Focusing on the negative will depress you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: One thing I did to help with depression is keep a checklist of things to do when I felt down:  call a friend, call a loved one to encourage THEM, go for a walk, eat fruits and veggies, read a book, go for a bike ride, etc.  Things like that, then I chose to do those things despite how I felt. Doing those things helped my mood TREMENDOUSLY>

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Feelings follow thoughts. If you think negative thoughts, you will feel negative. If you think positive thoughts, you will feel positive. Sometimes this takes time, but it works.  Just because you feel sad doesn't mean you should just do nothing, a person can TALK their way out of sadness and choose to do something different.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks your words of encouraging help me a lot

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am glad you were able to talk about how this is affecting you. I think many people are affected. And I encourage you to really do things you like and enjoy to keep your mood better. If you feel down, talk about it, pray about it but do NOT dwell on it, because that will bring you down.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes we get in a funk, when we do, we can pull ourselves out, I do suggest you write a list of things to do and put on the frige.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You are very correct I like you a lot

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you, how very sweet!  I do thank you for sharing your life with me. I'm an older person and this has affected me too.  Life is full of ups and downs, so I've been through some rough times. You can do this! :D

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is this a company where you see yourself getting a promotion?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Family is important. I can imagine how excited you have been to see your children again.

prefix_dialog.content: I have personally had to learn how to not buy into false guilt.  If you had plans, then they can ask some people to help out. prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for your advice , I think it all will work out, I think the “big guy” aka as the owner will understand the situation

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Exactly, she has to understand that life goes beyond work and I have been a very loyal worker for more than 18 years so I think she is trying to fight a fight where she definitely can lose

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I was just discussing with my husband how many people want to try and intimidate us lately. Seems so many are stressed out. I hope you have a Merry Christmas and really enjoy your visit with the kids.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: At this point , I don’t need the extra money , what I need is time to spend with my family and that’s exactly what I am going to do

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I agree with you!  It has been a tough year. Jobs come and go, but family is forever! :D

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: I understand your concern for your team. It sounds like you really care about their well-being.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, I do! But my priority right now is spending time with my kids, especially since it's been so long.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: I recently found out that my best friend has lied to me about her whole life, and when I invited to my home she finally told me the truth after staying for a month ad we were fighting for the entire month she stayed.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You have every right to be angry, but the most important thing you can do is find a good support system with your other friend. It will take some time to heal, but I'll tell you a paraphrased version of one of my favorite quotes: "Resentment is like swallowing poison and expecting the other person to die." It's important to find support in your other friends and heal properly.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds like a wonderful idea. Is there anything else you would like to discuss?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I also realized that I wasn't angry with my friend but rather myself

prefix_dialog.content: Can you elaborate more? Earlier you said you and your friend were arguing while she was living in your house, then she stopped talking to you. Why might you be angry with yourself?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Because I basically allowed her to use me for seven years and kept lying to me or gave her space because I thought I was being a good friend.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I feel like I was stupid to do that and soft

prefix_dialog.content: If I may, I would argue that your actions don't make you soft and they certainly don't make you stupid. They are certainly not any reason to be angry with yourself. If I may bring up another cliché: "Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me." I would say you're in the "fool me once" stage and it is your friend's actions that have brought you pain. I think you're unlikely to trust her again.

?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I know I want this though. I enjoy what I do and what I would do for my career if I graduate. I mainly feel inadequate. I feel that I am not good enough. I am willing to do whatever it takes but fear that whatever my "best" is may not be good enough.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can feel your worries when you speak about your anxiety, and I am hoping we can find a way to approach your feelings. Do you think there was a specific instance that is causing doubts within yourself or is it in your nature to self-doubt?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It is in my nature to self doubt. Additionally, I have had a few bumps in the road during my program and struggle to pick myself up after those bumps. For example, I am on academic probation and have a certain expectation over the next few months that I have to hit to stay in the program due to struggles in previous classes. I am reaching the bar just fine, according to those that I work with, and often feel I am doing quite well but occasionally I start to panic and think that I am not doing as well as I think that I am and start to spiral

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: This has also been a past struggle of mine, and I think it partially stems from the bar we set so high for ourselves. We obviously cannot reach the top right away, but have to work our way up. Often times, when facing an obstacle, such as a bad grade, we might retreat further down the path due to fear that it will keep happening. I know that I personally had a tendency to think of my family and friends who I feel are dependent on me or comparing myself with others when the only person we should think of in these instances is ourself. When making progress, tiny steps upward matter more than you think. But when we take a step backward, we cannot fall back down to the starting point by letting our doubts pile upon one another.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a really good point and helpful. Thank you!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Of course, I am happy to help! I have noticed that letting yourself celebrate a good grade can be really helpful to feel that you are enough and making good progress. But when things do go south, because life certainly happens, we must stay in the present and live life like we usually would, with a drive that we are going to push harder against whatever we have to face next.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is exactly right. I need to focus more on what progress has been made and not on what progress hasn't been made yet because there is still time to make that progress.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Exactly! I also suggest if you are having doubts, talk it out with someone like your partner or a close friend. They can often provide a pick me up you didn't even know you needed. More than anything, give yourself credit and relax. Take some time to just breathe and release the tension. I guarantee it will leave you feeling refreshed and fulfilled for the next tasks you have to face. I believe you can do this and I feel that you believe it too, which is amazing. As often as it is said, believing in yourself is truly the best foundation to achieve your goals.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content:
Thanks for the advice and believing in me. This has been challenging and your words of encouragement give me hope for the future
.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You're welcome. It was great talking to you. Your future is bright, and I wish you all of the luck for the endeavors to get you there.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's a great step! Mindfulness can be really helpful in grounding yourself. How do you feel it has impacted your day-to-day thoughts about the program?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.content: It's completely normal for those worries to come back, especially given your circumstances. Have you considered speaking with an academic advisor? They might provide additional support and resources to help you stay on track.

perience, it is easier to hold yourself accountable and slowly work your way through accomplishments, even small tasks, which is encouraging to continue.

prefix_dialog.content: /sounds like you are depressed ? Well I can assure you that I am here if you need or want to talk about why your depressed.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: when I get depressed , I just want to be by myself but it does help when I talk it out.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thank you for that. I am depressed due to the COVID pandemic. Stuck in the house for long time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can totally understand , with covid pandemic Its hard not to be depressed, considering all the changes going on.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Moreover, I have some deaths in the extended family due to COVID.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh! my having family members passing away is so awful , I am sorry to hear that and can understand why you are depressed.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yea, just trying to keep the spirit up and this depression keeps coming..

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you reached out to anyone for support?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Not really.. what would you suggest?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have had to in the past when I lost my dad, it wasnt due to covid but I really needed somone that didnt know me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Was it helpful?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Your family dr. would give you some information, that is how I was able to find somone. I was very thankful to my dr. And yes, it did help

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I might look for someone like that..

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: well it looks like you have a future plan, thats an awsome start. not to mention i will be here for you as well, ya know extra support.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: One other quick question.. was it in-person or remote?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You are welcome, I hope your day is better now , stay as positive as you can, trust me its not an easy thing to do when going through what your going through now.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened... I heard that one of my relatives might have tested positive for COVID, but I'm not sure if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds concerning. Do you know which relative it is or how they might have contracted it?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven't confirmed the details yet, so it's unclear if they really did or if it was just a rumor.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it clearly means that the situation is still quite serious for your family and you should prepare for the worst.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because the supporter jumps to a conclusion about the seriousness of the situation without asking for more information or clarification, ignoring the uncertainty expressed by the seeker in Turn 3.

samples.situation: I was in a relationship with the most beautiful woman that I have ever seen or been with. We have been dating for about 3 years and I was planning on spending the rest of my life with her. But I eventually lost her and everything all in a matter of months.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Well you see I am heartbroken and I can't seem to move on from a previous relationship, and its been over two years. Do you have any advice?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I’m understand how hard ending a relationship can be.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What do you find is the hardest thing for you each day. That is, where do you find it hardest to move on?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Well I would say mentally because I frequently think about her and constantly have memories throughout the day. Also when i hear a certain song or see a restaurant it makes me think of her.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Memories are a blessing and a curse. Are the memories and thought you are  having positive or negative?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: They are a mix of both because at one point they were positive and now when I think about it, it brings me down in a negative way.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: What have you done in the past to help you move on from a break up?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It’s hard when we have various emotions. These memories being more negative are hard to cope with. In my experience, if I rethink memories regarding relationships which tend to bring me down in way that is a learning experience, I feel more empowered.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah I agree that's what I have been doing too, and it's nice to know that you do the same.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: In my past I have been able to try and look at each  relationship as a chance to grow. To figure out what worked with that person and what didn’t. I have them used this as a tool for the future.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's a good way to look at it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You are making good steps to rethink the situations. Is there anything else contributing to the heat rack you still feel?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I recently came across some old photos of us, and it made me feel nostalgic. I remember the good times, but it also reminds me of how much I miss her.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely natural to feel nostalgic when looking at old photos. It sounds like those moments hold a lot of value for you.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Definitely. Sometimes I feel happy reliving those memories, but then I quickly feel the sadness of her not being here.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That emotional rollercoaster is very common. Perhaps you could focus on creating new memories and finding joy in the present, alongside cherishing the past.

samples.situation: COVID-19. has me needing people more.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hi how are you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Hi! so nice to chat with you today.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have also done that as well, though I do miss the human to human connection. I have learn how to knit, hot make bread ( yes! bread lol), and got out of my comfort zone and watched different genres of movies along with books. I am a creature of habit with set routine, I really tried to get out of my bubble as much as I can. Keeping my mind busy makes the days go by faster. have you tried to do something new and challenging?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: how to make**

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I saw that bread trend earlier in the pandemic. How did you do?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am thinking about going to the park...

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: well I can tell you, the first 3 times I tried to make 'regular bread' it was a disaster. my bread came out hard as a rock. I kept working at it. You are truly involved when making bread. Cool! I did not know it was a trend? look at me I am a trendsetter, lol. YES! I recommend that wholeheartedly, Ive walked and done more sight seeing during this pandemic than my entire life. Do you have scenic place to go? Do you like to read?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I do not have a scenic place but have some nice trails. I do read. I am reading bob iger's new autobiography.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Trails, offer an experience of letting go, I believe, you become immerse in nature. I would definitely explore all trails.  I did not know Iger had a book out. That sounds really interesting, I would actually love to read it, is it dull? or engaging? I do remember the headlines, he forgo his salary despite the risk of Disney losing billions in revenue, that takes guts. Do you have a pet?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: His book is good. Do you enjoy reading to help relax?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I need to pick it up and dive into it. I love reading, I always tend to have a book in my hands. Yes, reading has served to not only help me relax but to teach me how to do other things, like baking. what is your favorite book?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I love the Harry Potter book series. I picked up Sorcerer's Stone when I was 21 or 22 and it provided me with some alternative to the normal drinking and late nights I had grown accustom to. Helped me apprecate books more too!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Harry potter are THE books to dive into and just immerse yourself in. I would Highly recommend The Hobbit books, I was a bit hesitant about, but dare I say I like them more than Harry Potter? If you want something more adult and edgy go with Game of Thrones. I get it, I think this pandemic is a period to learn about ourselves and truly pick ourselves apart and see what we have missing out on.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have heard good things about Tolkin's books but have not gotten into them yet. I do like the movies though!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sounds to me you have been handling the pandemic a lot more better than what you actually think. I love movies as well, what is your favorite genre and movie?

prefix_dialog.content: I like movies. I usually like spy thrillers or at least have recently. What's yours?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You know what would be really cool to do, to join virtual admission to museums around the world. such a neat option that we now.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I’ve been thinking about how long this pandemic has been going on. It feels strange to be so disconnected from everyone.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: I hear you; it can be very tough to navigate feelings of disconnection, especially with everything happening around us. Have you found any specific activities that help you connect with people, even if it's virtual?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He said he has been struggling with depression and needed to be alone

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes having depression can make a person feel that they need to seclude themselves. Were you aware that he felt this way?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He has been distant recently.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Unfortunately that can be a sign of depression or that something is going on. Have you been able to communicate with him previously about becoming distant?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Every time I would bring it up he would dismiss it. I just don't know what to do. How can I get him back?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe you could try to talk to him about seeking help for depression? Talking to someone close to him or even a professional would help him immensely. Talking to a counselor would help him learn ways to cope with his feelings.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a good idea. I want him to get back to being himself. He is like a different person right now. It's scary.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand completely. Depression runs in my family and if it goes untreated, can scare anyone that is involved. You can try suggesting that he talks to a close friend, family member, or counselor to talk about how he is feeling and ways to cope with it. Sometimes medication could be a good way to fix the chemical imbalance that can cause depression.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I will try to help him, he just doesn't want to seem to talk to my anymore. Do you have any suggestions on how to approach it with him?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You could start a conversation by saying that you just want to check on him and see if he is okay and how he is doing. You don't want to start the conversation by immediately telling him to get help, as he might just get defensive.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a good approach. And you don't think I will further upset him?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I don't believe it will upset him if you ease into suggesting that he should talk to someone he is close to or seeing a professional. Your main goal is to check on him and make sure that he is okay since he seems to want to be alone and not talk to anyone. Once he tells you how he is doing you could mention that even talking to someone about his thoughts and feelings could lift a weight off his shoulders. If he seems that he doesn't really know why he feels the way does, you could suggest that medically speaking, sometimes our brains don't produce the chemicals that we need them to and it could make us feel bad. Seeing a professional to get their opinion would also help greatly.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I agree, I hope he is agreeable to all of this. I just miss him so much and want him back.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It's very hard to see someone we care about go through this.
